summary: Defines the core object model for the Open Library platform, providing classes that represent authors, works, editions, subjects, images, lists, users, and user groups. Each class encapsulates relevant attributes, URL construction, caching, and helper methods for accessing related data such as histories, collections, and ratings. The module also includes utilities for registering these models within the application framework.
business_intent: To supply a unified, objectâ€‘oriented abstraction of Open Library entities so that the rest of the system can retrieve, manipulate, and display bibliographic and user information consistently and efficiently.
